TopicTitle: Sub-assemblies have random rotation on some parts when moving in VAB

Articles.Content:
• KSP Version: 0.1.0.0.20892
  • Operating System: Windows 10 Pro 22H2
  • CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 2700X
  • GPU: NVIDIA RTX 3080TI
    • Driver: 528.49
  • Description of the bug.  
    • Expected Behavior: Parts can be moved through left click and attached as they were assembled.
    • Observed Behavior: When first clicking a sub-assembly, some parts will change their rotation to the default (a horizontal fuel tank may change to vertical).
      • I never observed it happening to the root part, or the part I clicked to move
  • Steps to Replicate: Happens seemingly randomly when clicking sub assembly to move it.
  • Fixes / Workarounds:  recopying it sometimes helps (only if its a duplicate of another part)
  • Other Notes / Screenshots / Log Files (if possible..)

This happened repeatedly to me, ended up changing my build order several times to get it on. Even manually trying to rotate it caused it to snap back the wrong way. A mid sized decoupler was the part for me.

This happens to me when I move a sub-assembly over another assembly. I think some parts are rotating to snap to snapping points on the other assembly, but without rotating the rest of the sub-assembly.
